conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C, and the task is to predict which container (D or E) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Three streams are starting from points labeled A, B, and C.
The liquid from A flows down and impacts the angled purple baffle.
The deflection from the purple baffle directs the liquid from A towards the left side.
The liquid from B flows downward and encounters the same purple baffle.
The deflection from the purple baffle directs the liquid from B towards the center.
The liquid from C flows down and hits the purple baffle.
The deflection from the purple baffle directs the liquid from C towards the right side.
After deflection from the purple baffle, the streams are directed horizontally.
The liquids encounter the angled grey baffle, which redirects their paths downward.
The liquid from A, being deflected to the left, will flow into container D.
The liquid from B, being directed to the center, will predominantly flow into container E.
The liquid from C, being deflected to the right, will flow into container E.
Container D will receive liquid from A, and container E will receive liquid from B and C.
The liquid will flow into container E after passing through the baffles.
